title: [Large-Scale] Sustainable Science Inquiry E-Learning Program Development Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic e-learning development processes, experience in science education, comprehension of fundamental principles of variable control and experimental design
context.additional_context: Learners study stakeholder-centered design frameworks reflecting scientific inquiry processes to acquire practical skills for developing science e-learning content. Operated as a short-term intensive course with virtual experiments and data analysis practices in a blended environment using personal devices

learning_goals: Learners can explain the design process for a science inquiry-based e-learning program, reflecting stakeholder requirements, in three stages: [hypothesis formulation → experimental design → result analysis].
Teams can create a development plan for a cost- and operationally efficient science experiment simulation e-learning program.
Learners can produce standardized science data measurement/analysis content using learning object repositories and template-based documentation tools.

resources: Open content library for science disciplines

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
